structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Witnessesâ€™ Fees; Refusal In Certain Cases
law.text: If, on the trial of a criminal case, it appears that a witness has induced the defendant to commit the crime with which he is charged with intent to appear as a witness against him, the court or magistrate may in his discretion refuse to allow him his fees.
